website_summaries.verdict: These goggles offer notable comfort and style for a mid-level price, but the performance may not suit serious winter athletes.
pros: Goggles offer a solid build and comfortable fit for a reasonable price
Goggles fit well with most helmets
Frameless wide-lens look is stylish and comes in several color options
cons: The lens has the tendency to scratch easily, so you must handle them with care
It also tends to fog up in some conditions

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Got a ton of scratches the first day and I was very careful. Also, fogs up and then freezes in 5 minutes. Pretty much useless and ruined the snowy day on the slopes.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: They fit like Smith, but my wallet still has dollars in it
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They fit just like the Smith I/o. (see pictures) I love how comfortable the foam is and how easy it is to change out the lens! They fit really well with my Smith Maze helmet. I like that they sit a little lower on my cheeks and nose because it will help keep my nose warmer in winter as well as increase visibility. The foam is really breathable. the strap feels durable. Looking forward to having a few other lenses, but this murder black lens is so cool! You will not find a better goggle in this price range. This is comparable to Smith.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina K

customer_reviews.title: Shreddy Ready
customer_reviews.text: I'm excited to take these goggles out! I got the Stealth Jet color, and they gray matches perfect with any of my jackets/gear. Not only do they look sick, but they also have some nifty features. My favorite feature is the (easily) interchangeable lenses. The magnets help me make sure the lenses are in the right spot before the side clamps ensure they won't fall out. I was worried about ordering goggles online, but they fit really well with my helmet ( a Giro surface). If you have a small head, I would try the juniors.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Whats with these lenses?
customer_reviews.text: Super, super dark lenses, even on the brightest day here in Colorado. Overall build quality of the goggles is fine, but I bought these specifically because I wanted the daylight lenses. Just be aware that they grey out a ton of terrain and unlike the other daylight lenses I've used, you lose a lot of terrain contrast.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Large. Not made to be snug enough for adult woman head.
customer_reviews.text: The adult size is quite large and even at the tightest setting, it’s still not snug for my average sized head. I got this at a special price and Amazon will not exchange these for a smaller (youth) size. Since I cannot wear these goggles, my review is not great. Ladies, Beware of the large size and consider ordering the youth size instead. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE!!
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are awesome! I love that the lens is so easy to switch out. Honestly I'm not good with that kind of stuff and usually get so frustrated but it was second nature and so self explanatory. The magnet is strong too, it locks it right into the exact place that it needs to be. I also love how flexible the frame is. And that there is ventilation. I hate when goggles get fogged up. They also just look soooooo sleek. I'm way pumped to use them this season!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price, But
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are great for the price, honestly I’ve worn the $200 ones and these are just as easy to see through BUT the damn lenses pops off constantly if you’re trying to pull them off and your hand slips too far forward. They need to make it harder to unhinge the front pieces to replace the lenses because several times I was cursing at them after my hand slipped, which isn’t hard to do in bulky ski gloves when they’re half numb anyway.
customer_reviews.author: HoustonShopGirlKC

customer_reviews.title: Good goggles
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like these goggles. They look good and are comfortable. I really like how the air vents are out away from the forehead so they don't get blocked by headware. What I don't like is the fact that I can see them in my field of view. Im definitely not implying the obstruct my FOV, but I'm used to goggles that you can't see the frame when wearing them. Not a deal breaker, just an annoyance. The best quality of these goggle is the magnetic lens. Theyre extremely easy to remove and replace. Because of this and the FOV I'll primarily be using these googgles as a backup or when I need to switch to a lower light lens.
customer_reviews.author: Reg

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Goggles, Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are great. We also own the Wildhorn helmets and they pair perfectly. We have used the goggles on about 10 days of skiing in Colorado this season. We have 4 sets all together, 2 adults and 2 junior. My wife and I also have 2 sets of lenses, dark and high vis. We have had zero fogging issues and the magnetic attachments for the lenses make them extremely easy to change out. Not only are they functional but they look great as well. I highly recommend these goggles especially over the more well known brands you’ll find at the ski shop.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Mid-range goggle, fogs in wet conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Goggles fit over and stay seated well over both Smith helmets, and one Wildhorn helmet we have. Worn with Blackstrap pulled up over nose - FOG. Pulled down nose/mouth exposed no fog, but with the wet ski day it was awful. Our son wore his goggles with outdoor research balaclava - great mouth/nose vents. FOG. Fogging, can’t stand it. We both are going back to our smith goggles on wet ski days. Line of sight - meh - they are similar to some of our smaller smith/dragon goggles, not as wide or open not sold. Will try these again this week - ski conditions will be dry/sub zero - hopeful they work in these conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Honeycutt aka Persnickety’s KNITS

customer_reviews.title: Going back to Smith.
customer_reviews.text: These are ok if you just don't want to drop the cash on a tight fitting pair, but if I wore these up on the mountain I know I would be super annoyed by the second run. The fit is just not as good and it feels loose over my nose. Faces are all shaped different so this may not be the case for you. I cannot speak to the anti fog or anything else. Loved the color though, it was beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Coluembe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ski Goggle
customer_reviews.text: The ski goggle provides great visibility, the foam around is very comfortable to my face and it is very easy to change the lenses but I do not recommend to do it on the lift because the rare magnets are quite strong. It fits well on my helmet and do not fog. I bought this with the black one which look likes polarised sunglasses with it is very relaxing in a bright day, However on cloud day or by the end of the day becomes a challenge, So far my favorite lens is the Blaze one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Steezy
customer_reviews.text: I really like these goggles! Arizona weather on the mountain create a perfect recipe for fogged goggles. Last time out all my buddies goggles fogged up all day to the point they would take them off. I did get minor fog around the edges at times but considering the state of my buds I was happy with the results. Never had to take them off. Never made me mad cause I couldn't see. Super comfy. Great viewing angle. I literally have gotten compliments every time I ride. Now I just need different lenses for different conditions.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent "Infiniti" Goggles
customer_reviews.text: I looked at quite a few goggles from Smith, Oakley, etc. that were all $150-300 for this type of goggle. I ended up giving these a shot based on the reviews and cost. Very glad I did. Absolutely the best value all in, but also exceptional goggles in their own right with excellent visual acuity. The blue mirror performed well in sunny all the way to slightly overcast conditions and purchased the yellow mirror lenses separately for low light. Lenses are very easy to swap out on the fly, and the lenses come with a soft wipe cover. Skied 5 days with these a few weeks back and very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Omahasandman

customer_reviews.title: Worked great under all conditions except very flat light
customer_reviews.text: They don’t fog. They don’t freeze. Mine have not scratched, although I have seen that as a complaint. After reading that people had trouble with scratching I ave been compulsive about keeping the lenses I’m not using in their sleeves and getting the goggles back into their case. I thought my wife had sent too much on these for me. Then I priced high end goggles and these are actually a great deal. And except for very flat light conditions they could not have been better. Super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom L

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely gorgeous ski goggles. I got the blue and they are really magnificent. Extremely comfortable to wear. I like that they have a magnetic lens that you can change and it has a lock. It took me reading the instructions thoroughly to understand how to use that feature, but well worth it. The lens itself is wide, so I don't feel like I'm losing tons of peripheral vision. I hate goggles that give you that tunnel vision. They are adjustable, very stylish, and a super great value. I can't wait to go on our ski trip. Definitely the coolest and nicest goggles I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Deloris P.

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the snow.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing that I noticed was how nicely they were packaged. It was like opening a gift on Christmas Day. They come in a protective soft plastic pouch and in a soft cloth-like bag that makes them easy to store and travel with. The design is simple and sleek. I love how easy it is to pop the lens in and out for cleaning needs or to switch up the tint. They are soft on the face but don't move around too easily and are easy to adjust. Whether you are a man, woman, or child, I recommend getting these goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Crisp, clean, and stylish
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for some new goggles for the upcoming season and I could not be more pleased with these goggles. They are sleek, have a great lens that is of great quality and quick to change. I also have a small face and feel that they still fit snugly on my face. The wide lens is an added bonus. Last comment is that the packaging was simple with minimal packaging. I appreciate this to cut down on plastic waste. I hate opening packages and quickly throwing most of it away. #hippyobservations Can't wait to get on the slopes with these beauties!
customer_reviews.author: Don McKean

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Goggles
customer_reviews.text: Amazing goggles, especially for the price. One of the best lens change systems I've ever come across, literally takes 5 seconds to swap out. I rode at A Basin in Colorado and the weather changed from sunny to snow storms and I had perfect vision the entire time. My previous goggles would constantly fog up when the temperature got warm and these didn't fog up at all the entire day. I've already ordered two extra replacement lenses, for $23 it's a hard deal to beat. Would absolutely recommend these goggles to anyone who rides.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K.

customer_reviews.title: Really Good, Just a Couple of Caveats...
customer_reviews.text: Good goggles for the money with a couple of drawbacks. 1 - They do limit peripheral vision a bit more than standard Smith or Oakley goggles. It doesn't really bother me, but it is noticable both horizontally and vertically. 2 - The goggles do not have a tacky patch on the straps to help them stick to your helmet and not slip. I have a broken clip on my helmet, so it bothered me. Everything else I liked.
customer_reviews.author: church00

customer_reviews.title: Excellent eye protection!
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great fit, durability and option to change lenses for different conditions Con: sits somewhat lower on the nose bride; not all lenses are available (out of stock) Overall: Happy with purchase, first day of use took some time to get used the lower sitting frame (could just be my face structure), but will continue to use and interchange the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: MommaO

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, these fog up & freeze.
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hope's for these beautiful googles. Unfortunately they did not meet expectations. Temps were cold, zero degrees. The lenses fogged up quickly and then froze on the inner part of the lense. Yes. I was wearing a mask, but my trusty old pair of Scott's had no issues with fogging up or freezing up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Switched from anon- never going back!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a pair of high end anons with these. I used these on a few trips this past winter and gotta say they’re awesome. No fogging, comfortable fit and got a lot of compliments on the mountain. Nobody ever complimented my anons ;( But seriously these things are legit! Will never pay $200+ again! If you’re on the fence about going with youth size or adult, I added a pic next to my adult anons. The Wildhorn youth are slightly bigger and the lenses have more peripheral vision. If you don’t have a really big head, the youth may be a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fogging goggles
customer_reviews.text: The goggles are comfortable in all respects all the features are there. But I had a very bad fogging issue with them. The weather was very cold -15/-20 Fahrenheit. I don’t know if any goggle can stay clear in those temperatures. I was wearing a face mask and yes the mask probably funneled The vapor up into the goggles. At the warm up huts numerous people were thawing out their masks. Not necessarily this brand but it seemed to be a common problem in those temps. I purchased them for the anti fog. Ability. In the warmer temperatures fogging was not an issue
customer_reviews.author: Juan Robard

customer_reviews.title: Great set of goggles from a great company!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of goggles! The ease of changing lenses is fantastic. Definitely going to order the other lenses. They fit great and are very comfortable. They might want to think about putting their name in the band - great chance for advertising - but the simplicity of the design is cool too. Looking forward to using these on the mountain all winter long! Another great product from Wildhorn, I’ve bought several of their products and have loved everyone of them.
customer_reviews.author: SAMCR0

customer_reviews.title: Good visibility, look awesome, but fogs up a little.
customer_reviews.text: They look great and have really good visibility. Only problem is they fog up on top where my helmet visor area makes contact with the goggles. The vent on top gets blocked I guess. If I wore a beanie, I'm sure it would be ok, but everyone should wear a helmet, so... not sure how to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: These goggles are insanely huge & unable to return
customer_reviews.text: The fit around my head was a bit lose even with the band adjusted as tight as the strap would allow. I’m 5’5” 125# with an average build/bone structure. According to the website even smaller females should order an adult size. I think the picture speaks for itself. Adult size is too big for smaller females. My family and friends just laugh when I put them on🤣i had planned to return but missed return window by 5 days. This was a complete waste of $70. I’m so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Crabb

customer_reviews.title: They scratch very easily, and fingerprints will not come off.
customer_reviews.text: The googles are comfortable, and the wide peripheral vision is nice . The problem is with the lens. They scratch very easily, and if you touch them with your fingers, the fingerprints will not come off. Before purchasing, I recommend that you consider how easily they scratch, and that the fingerprints will not come off.
customer_reviews.author: terry w wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice goggles
customer_reviews.text: Only got to use them once but the lens worked well for a sunny spring day and they were comfortable. The only thing I didn't like is they're too bulky, they look like big bug eyes. I'm tired of buying expensive goggles and having the lens get scratched (seems like Oakley is the worst for that) or foam gaskets ripping too easily. If I can get one full ski season from these it'll be worth the little money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Why?!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Dear God - why are these goggles so freakin’ huge?! Do I have a child’s face? Everyone else in the photos looks all normal but somehow I look like a fly!! I was going to return them but gave them to my hubby instead and he looks ok in them.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Owen

customer_reviews.title: Time to get rid of Oakley and Smith
customer_reviews.text: Time to get rid of Oakley and Smith....I bought these goggles and different lenses. Figured because of the cost, why not?!?! Worst case scenario, I would just return them on Amazon if they are horrible. Welp, I have told everyone at work about them and I work at a Ski Resort. Say bye bye Oakley and Smith...for the cost, these are the ways to go with the same performance.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Zemnick

customer_reviews.title: Get more then what you pay for. Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I’ve had Smiths (not the cheap ones), Von Zippers and Giro’s in the past. I’d say these are up there with them, just half the cost. The average I was spending was around $120-$150, and that wasn’t with changeable Covers. These are sturdy and breathable. Don’t fog up on me when I’m getting a little heated. Eye sight is nice, have a clear side to side and straight forward vision. Replaceable Lenses makes it’s great for those cloudy days vs sunny days. They have great information on all the different sun levels in their description was is very helpful and spot on. Would recommend to any level skier or boarder.
customer_reviews.author: Mark n Cort

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: (I’m the girl in the photo wearing wild horn brand goggles). These goggles were excellent. Really. They just didn’t pair nicely with my Oakley helmet and overtime the foam portion (on my 3rd day of skiing - with active snow coming down) got wet, leading to unnecessary moisture on my face. However, the visibility was excellent. They look expensive. And they totally did the job. I will continue to wear these - the price is unmatched.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Patroller thinks the fit and durability are great!
customer_reviews.text: Goggles fit well. Very comfortable to wear for long periods. Feel solid like they will be durable which is important as a patroller after a local ski resort. The fit is perfect with my old smith helmet. I hate giggle gaps and these align perfectly. Lens switching is as easy as it says. I have patroller friends with other magnetic goggles and the lens falls off when we have to chuck our gear to help a patient. These stay on perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: chad anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great goggle but just wish it had a little more peripheral vision
customer_reviews.text: These googles are very good overall. The lens system is really easy and makes them feel premium to me. However the biggest downside is that peripheral vision with the goggles on isn't that wide and I still find myself wanting something with more visibility. If you're like me and want to see 180 I wouldn't recommend these and to just pay more for some that will offer that vision. That said these googles look great and I'd recommend these for about 85% of the population.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as more expensive pairs, if not better!
customer_reviews.text: (After 3 full days using) Beware that you cannot wear the blue at night because it is too dark, and you should order a less tinted lenses for night (i ordered the amber replacement lenses and they are FANTASTIC and only 20$ for just the lense.) Super easy to replace lenses in 15 seconds. These have never fogged up, and have not scratched at all. I love these and would recommend them to anyone. You CANNOT see your eyes with the blue, and also you can't see your eyes with the amber. Both are extremely mirrored and looks amazing. Do yourself a favor and get a pair!!
customer_reviews.author: sunnybeach

customer_reviews.title: Colorado Company
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to purchase from a USA company and still receive a decent price. From the packaging to the product, I was very impressed. I unfortunately purchased the child size as I have a very small head, and they are a tad too small, but they still worked fine and that was my issue, not the companies. They didn't fog up and the vision through the goggle was great. Thank you for making a great goggle, keep up the great 5 star products!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lernihan

customer_reviews.title: I was hopeful, but let down.
customer_reviews.text: These things look great but that’s about where it ends. Like others have stated, if you use with a face mask or neck warmer, they will fog up. I used them on a snowy 20* day in Vermont and the snow was able to get in the goggles and buy my face. In addition it didn’t block much wind. My eyes would water as if I was goggleless... if the U.S ski team is actually using these, the team is doomed!
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Stoked on these Goggles!!
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with these goggles. It's been a while since I have been needing a pair of easy-to-change lenses for the mountain. I am super excited about the durability of the lens as well. These lens are thick and just right for a gnarly powder day. I would also highly recommend these for comfort purposes. When I tried these on in my bedroom, it almost felt like the comfort of a pillow on my face. I don't normally leave reviews, but these Rocas are dope and I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: R. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Value
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good pair of goggles for quite some time now and am very happy with my WildHorn purchase. I ski with a helmet almost all of the time and the fit is great. The goggles are comfortable and I have had no issues with vision or fogging. I haven't used the lens changing system yet but it looks very easy to operate and something that will come in handy I am sure during days with changing conditions. For the price these goggles present a great value. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent deal.
customer_reviews.text: Great set of goggles. They may be a touch to big and smush the nose a little but that could just be that they don’t work with my helmet. All in all, a great purchase for the money. Please make spare lenses available on the page with the goggles or at least link up to them in the description if you can. It was tough finding them.
customer_reviews.author: graffiti

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Great goggles and love the lenses and how easy they are to swap out. Used them on SnowMass for some snowboarding last week and they worked better than my $200 dollar pair of a well known brand. The magnets are very strong, however i did manage to knock the lens off one time when I ate powder pretty good. Definitely worth the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian PorchMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent goggles
customer_reviews.text: I had already purchased 2 of these goggles and just bought another one as a gift for a friend of mine. Great quality goggle with very reasonable price. The magnetic interchangeable lens system is also brilliant. Nothing less than my Oakley Airbrake actually! The only thing that I wish to have is the silicone on the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great for skier with glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Our skier was struggling with wearing contacts while racing. They irritate her eyes but she has to have some vision correction to see the gates. These goggles were the perfect solution. She can change out the lenses without even taking them off, and also to adjust her glasses if needed. Her glasses stay in place while skiing but don't mash her face. They didn't fog in our high humidity area. The lenses do scratch easily but that is always the case, especially with a teenager who is rough and tumble.
customer_reviews.author: lorelei

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. One other person commented about needing a rubber grip on the strap, which would be amazing, but with mine being clipped in I’ve had not one issue of the strap sliding around. I got the black lenses and they are DARK. I would highly recommend getting another lens to go with it I got the yellow mirrored lens and they work great on heavy overcast days. The lens switch system is fantastic, extremely fast and easy. I also have the helmet that they make and it butts up perfectly against it. If you are on the fence about buying these like I was “for months” don’t be they are great.
customer_reviews.author: bryan engler

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these goggles!!! Great fit with the WildHorn helmet. The change out magnetic system for lenses is easy and quick - which is a major plus when it’s cold out. They are just like my Oakleys (but for the fraction of the price). The only thing I didn’t like was the fact that I couldn’t get the best seal around my face so a little bit of air was getting in when I was riding. Maybe it’s just me. Overall, a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Lark

customer_reviews.title: Defective lens, see photo
customer_reviews.text: Literally just received these today and first thing I notice is appears to be a huge scratch across the lens. What it actually is is glue or something trapped between two layers of the lens. It won’t rub off. Looks like poor manufacturing and very annoying to look through.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: Scratches super easily
customer_reviews.text: I like these goggles. However, I cleaned them with a soft cloth and they scratched everywhere. I have no clue how because I’ve used this same goggle cleaner on every other pair of goggles and have never had this issue. They look great though.
customer_reviews.author: slsphilly

customer_reviews.title: fog a little but overall good
customer_reviews.text: I tried various goggles and these are very fair for the price. They did fog a little but nothing major. I also skied during overcast weather and the lens is bright enough but would not recommend for evening skiing. Otherwise a great find for the price.
customer_reviews.author: W.E.

customer_reviews.title: You should probably buy these
customer_reviews.text: Awesome goggles. They look good, perform well and the lens changing system is super easy. My favorite thing though is that they don't fog up. Every other pair I've had fogs when using a neck gaiter tucked over the nose, these don't. I've always been an Oakley guy, but these are better and cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Keebler

customer_reviews.title: Best goggles ever
customer_reviews.text: No question. I've owned dozens of goggles in my life and these are by far the best. They are durable and super high quality. The system for exchanging lenses is incredibly innovative, the magnets are so cool. I love these. They are a bit bigger than goggles you might be used to, but I actually find that it is appropriately sized to match and feel like it's one unit with your helmet. Must buy.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these goggles for a friend as a gift and really liked them. So, I got myself a pair. I love them! I got the purple/green lens. There work great in flat, low light and bright sun. Fit on my helmet great and comfortable to wear all day skiing. You can't go wrong with the price either. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Narrow FOV
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an older goggle (the non-wraparound style) but when I tried them on it just felt like they stood off too far from my face, I had less field of view than my old goggles and certainly nothing like the outside of this would look like. Seemed decently well constructed but as far as I'm concerned wasn't as useful as my $20 Scotts.
customer_reviews.author: Arc212

customer_reviews.title: Fits over glasses!
customer_reviews.text: Have not used them yet. Bought them for my 12 year old son who wears glasses. Last year the goggles he had would fog up and could not wear his glasses with them. These arrived last week and he was so excited because not only do they look really cool they fit over his glasses very nicely. Can’t wait to test them out next month! If they go on sale again I will be buying another one for sure.
customer_reviews.author: A.V.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and then some
customer_reviews.text: These are the first pair of goggles I’ve owned that made it all day without ever fogging up! Wildhorn knows what they’re doing and who they’re doing it for. You won’t find better goggles at this price or even around $150.00 ! This is my first review about any product I’ve ever bought on Amazon only because I felt everyone needed to know how good this product truly is. And yes... I did buy these and will be looking into other snow gear they offer
customer_reviews.author: Lance Dearman

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitting Goggles That Looks Good and Does The Job Well!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. He likes it that they fit over his glasses. He likes the technology and the fact lenses can be changed out for varying degrees of light and has already asked for low light lenses. This is a great feature! It makes the difference between wearing or not wearing protective eyewear on the slopes!
customer_reviews.author: Fir Tree

customer_reviews.title: Great google. Works well over glasses
customer_reviews.text: These look great. They are super comfortable and do not fog up. For years I wore crappy goggles that fogged and gave me a limited field of vision. These open up the view! I’m very happy with this purchase. The price is absolutely reasonable for a goggle of this quality. I wear these over glasses too btw.
customer_reviews.author: N-A

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Wildhorn Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Wildhorn fan. Very eco-friendly U.S. company and all their stuff that I have purchased is top quality and great value - these goggles are no exception. I previously bought Wildhorn's Cristo goggles (also great), but just got the Roca to give as a gift. Roca has interchangeable lenses which I really like. Wildhorn sells a range of lens colors and shades for different light conditions, and also some cool interchangeable straps. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great looking goggles, weak lens not scratch-resistant
customer_reviews.text: Product was advertised as fog and scratch resistant, and they didn't make it 2 days w/o getting scratched. I was at a small mountain this weekend and never had a fall that would have caused them to scratch and was extremely careful with them when I wasn't wearing them. Then, I noticed what looked like a smudge while going up the lift and realized they're scratched up. Seems like the outer lens is very scratch-prone and nervous to buy a new lens in case it just happens again. Otherwise, they do look great and are extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: LisaS

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fog up
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these goggles a week before a Colorado skiing trip. The reviews all were great so i tried them. They were excellent! I used to just use cheapo goggles from Walmart. These goggles never fogged up on me and helped my eyes with the brightness. Hundred percent recommend for skiing or snowboarding
customer_reviews.author: holly

customer_reviews.title: Good but not compatible with my helmet
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality for the price. Liked the blue lenses. However, I had to return because they didn't fit with my Bolle helmet.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive goggle
customer_reviews.text: Just used my Wildhorn ski goggles for the first time while skiing today. It was about 32' and overcast with snow flurries all day. The goggles kept my eyes warn and dry. They never fogged up and never needed to be wiped down. At this price point I would definitely recommend. I hope they hold up well and will report back at the end of the ski season.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Medic

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels just like advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of a switchable lenses and the look of these goggles. I just used them and couldn’t be happier. A well built product that doesn’t fog up on you. Seeing through these gave me way more peripheral vision than other goggles. Would highly recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Cornaby

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and durable
customer_reviews.text: Used these in Whistler Canada this morning and it was good. I baught the spare cleaer lense also, they can fog up slightly if you are using a face shield but they defog rapidly when u turn ur face to let air in thru the vents. I would compare them to 140$ pair any day. Make sure you buy the spare diff lens just in case, I'm glad I did cause Whistler got foggy and cloudy.
customer_reviews.author: zak

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a very nice quality goggle. Super easy to remove lenses and swap out for weather conditions. Very clear and don’t fog up while out skiing. Super comfortable and look very nice. Only dislike was the carrying bag. Fits the goggles just fine but I purchased another set of lenses for night skiing and they don’t fit in the bag with the goggles so would be nice for a better bag or a case included to carry the accessories for it.
customer_reviews.author: stu

customer_reviews.title: Nice well priced goggles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at the last minute for skiing and worried about an unknown brand. They were great. Heavy enough to feel substantial. Clear vision. Only reason I am Gi jng it a 4 vs 5 is because the strap kept slipping off my helmet. Could have been user error but I have never had that problem before.
customer_reviews.author: RLH

customer_reviews.title: Best looking and comfortable ski googles I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I got these anticipating an epic ski season this year. I've had problems with magnets failing on previous goggles in the past so the side locking mechanism for the swap-able lens caught my eye and I can tell you, this is what every other other similar system is missing. Besides being functional, and stylish... these are also by far one of the most comfortable ski googles I've ever strapped to my face.
customer_reviews.author: Easton

customer_reviews.title: These have been great!
customer_reviews.text: These goggles have held up great so far this season. Love the blue tint. Good field of vision. Fits well over most helmets, haven't tried wearing them under the helmet. The quick release feature is an awesome bonus, but haven't had to switch out lenses yet when I've been out skiing. For the price, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: The black lens is great on sunny days. The goggles are comfortable and don't fog even when I get a sweat going. They fit perfectly with the Drift helmet. I wish I bought a lens for the overcast days, but that will be the next purchase. Great product and company.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles!
customer_reviews.text: Got these when they were deal of the day. Nice look with all lense in the front. Got bummed when all the extra lenses happened to sell out the next week. But that's not a knock on the product or the company. Ended up picking up a spare lense and couldn't be happier! (Picture is with the second pair of lenses)
customer_reviews.author: master katsu

customer_reviews.title: Junior one is not as picture.
customer_reviews.text: I bought both adult and junior and found that the junior one was made diferently. The top part is missing the white plastic cover. The advertised picture is for the adult only.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: These are the real deal!
customer_reviews.text: I got these goggles on sale for $40 but even at full price I would recommend them. They come packaged in a nice bag and the build quality is solid. They fit very comfortably and the field of view is very good! The strap is super easy to adjust and in my opinion the best part of these goggles are the easily changeable lenses. This is perfect for when I snowboard in different conditions and need certain visibility. Overall I highly recommend this product! The quality is on par with other top brands and the price can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Omar Mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: Good looking goggles
customer_reviews.text: These googles seem to be well made and the fit and feel was nice. I didn't have any issues with them fogging up and they seem to be a good value for the cost. My only issue was that they come with a very dark lens. I had to order a lighter one which was an additional 25$.
customer_reviews.author: Rnman

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these goggles because of the price but I am so impressed. I bought a pair for my boyfriend and he loves them too. They provide a wide visual field, are comfortable and fit so well. This specific lens color is SO cute and worked really well in cloudy to partly sunny conditions. The ability to buy a bunch of lenses and switch them out is a great feature. I totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Customer Service!!!
customer_reviews.text: Put the excellent product aside, all the various lenses in different shades available, the ease of changing lenses, all absolutely great. The thing that impressed me the most is their, not 5, but 10 star customer service. I was a real pain and they bent over backwards to treat me like their most important customer, I love them and highly recommend any purchase since you know they will always take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good product 99% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: These worked well on a trip to AK snowmaching. Did have problems twice when weather was 20-25 below zero. The lens would fog because all moisture was freezing in the vents. I cannot blame the product as it was extremely cold. A second pair would be advisable then tuck frozen pair in jacket to thaw and wear new set until frozen, repeat until at destination. For the price it is a viable option if you don’t wear a heated helmet
customer_reviews.author: kevin mcdonough

customer_reviews.title: Great idea with the magnetic lens technology.
customer_reviews.text: I received my goggles yesterday and am impressed with the magnetic lens system. They have a great fit and should provide excellent protection on sunny days on the mountain. I am looking forward to purchasing more lens combinations to use for different conditions. Compared to other lens change outs with previous goggles I have owned this is as simple as it gets and with how the magnets are spaced, it make it impossible to not line up.
customer_reviews.author: Lindzi B.

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey for what it is
customer_reviews.text: They’re just OK. I find them to be bulky and heavy. Good peripheral vision but the lense is nothing special. They’re also pretty large and bug eyed, so when wearing a helmet they push down on my nose. After giving these a shot for a couple of outings I ended up buying Anon Helix 2.0s which are better in every way - for about 30$ more. If you don’t need an OTG fit or have a large face - I recommend spending a few more bucks on a better goggle, or way less money on an entry level pair.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rotolo

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, Functional, and Innovate Product!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t wait to try these out this Ski Season! I’ve finally found something that has premium features without a premium price! This stylish product is comfortable, and it fits my face... The magnetic system for holding the lens on is great! No more fumbling, in cold weather like used to when I had to change the lens out. This new system will no longer be a drag, when I need to make a quick adjustment for viewing options! Overall, I think Wild Horn Outfitters hit a home run for a new product... The toughest part will be waiting till Ski Season to try this product out (still September) Can’t wait to see what future lens options may be released!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce D Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great to wear when not moving
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these for a snowboarding trip I took...while I like the look of them while sitting in the sun....I found it impossible to wear while actually on the slopes because the tint made it hard to see...but that's from the perspective have a complete snowboarding noob.
customer_reviews.author: W. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Always nervous about an unknown entity but watched the video and I thought they looked good. Day 1 with the new goggles was spectacular with excellent comfort and clear vision on a bluebird day. Never got to use my additional low light lens but that looks great too. No fogging with full face coverage. I have a hard time believing that the much more expensive brands are 3 times better. I love a good value and these DEFINITELY are!
customer_reviews.author: TRC

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: These goggles shocked me. Usually with ski goggles you get what you pay for. For being priced low, compared to some ski goggles, you definitely get wayyyy more than you pay for. Great fit. Love how they look. Lense are awesome and to change the lense out is the simplest system I’ve seen in a pair of goggles. These goggles are amazing! Definitely get more than you pay for which is hard to find in the ski industry.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Fairman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ski goggles
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ski goggles, easy to change lens based on sun light conditions. One shortcoming is the strap doesn't have the rubber to increase the friction on the helmet, so when I put my goggles on the helmet it sometimes bounced back and got loose.
customer_reviews.author: zyzgerry

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: High quality build, comfortable and good look. The magnetic clips is also great Cons: Lens clarity - OK but not comparable to Smith Chromopop (admittedly that is a lot more expensive), and some fogging. Overall, if I'm price conscious this would be a definite winner. But as I was not happy with lens clarity and fog vs. Smith, I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have had other polarized goggles that I could wear on a cloudy day. These are really dark and I will have buy an amber lens which I had not intended. Otherwise, they seem like good quality. I have not been able to test them for anti fogging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality look and feel for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter for her birthday, after buying and receiving a pair of Zionor goggles that were a bit less expensive. These definitely had a higher quality look and feel compared to the Zionor and so I gave her the Wildhorns and will keep the Zionors as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: C Sully

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by these. I was pretty happy with this purchase. I've only used them for one trip, but they worked great! I did get a scratch pretty easily on the lense. I don't notice it when wearing them so it's fine at the moment. The wonderful news about that is the replacement lens is affordable and easy to change out. I did get a low light lens as well and used that most of the time on this particular trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Secure fit, good interchangeable lenses, great design!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a skier; these goggles are very comfy, feel well made, are easily adjustable. The interchangeable lenses grab in easily d/t the magnet, then the clips firmly clip the lenses in. Great design! Only wish the goggles came w/ a case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I don't snowboard often, and these were the first goggles I ever had to wear. Im not totally in love with them but im not unimpressed. They did their job, and considering many other options are much more expensive I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise!
customer_reviews.text: Update: got fogged up between the two lenses at the 3rd use. Ruined a day. Got returned. Disappointing. Original review Very comfortable goggles, no fogging and perfect for PNW cloudy days. Fit OK on my Smith Holt helmet. Got at a bargain promotion prom Amazon so price point was strong.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Really good for the $60
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy goggles. FOV is almost as big as your eyes can see (you can slightly see the edges), which is very good. Goggles have VERY strong magnets to keep the lens in; the "side-clips" are incredible. The lens is a dual-lens--the inside lens can have a slightly different temperature than the outside lens; allows for the use of a balaclava to even cover your nose. Strap is both short and long enough for helmets. Go nicely with the WildHorn helmet.
customer_reviews.author: StormBreaker

customer_reviews.title: Best Goggles. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these goggles for almost a year now. I go snowboarding at least once a week as long as we have snow so these things got a workout. First off, they are very comfortable and I can wear them all day. Second, they fit perfectly with the widhorn and many other brand of helmets. Most importantly, THEY WILL NOT FOG UP. Being an east coast rider, we can get days anywhere from the 20's to the 50's and no matter how much I sweat or how cold it is, these things refuse to fog up.
customer_reviews.author: jBarlow

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality and Super Cool
customer_reviews.text: Bought these the other day and I'm stunned! The quality of the glass, foam, and all around design is awesome! The easy magnetic pop out of the shield is dope too, gonna get a few colors to mix it up on the slopes. So far so good with these bad boys! Can't wait to use them again
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn decent...
customer_reviews.text: These were good but not great- still struggles to see bumps on a cloudy day- but for the price they were good. Held up well to a week of skiing. And I doubt you’d beat the price anywhere. They were on sale and cost less than a good pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: happy couple

customer_reviews.title: Beginners ONLY
customer_reviews.text: If you're not a beginner don't use them! no peripheral vision, anti fog is decent no silicon for straps to hold on into the helmet ! anti-reflective coating on lenses so I was able to see my eyeballs in lens!
customer_reviews.author: Saf

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Don't Fog Up, Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic ski goggles for the price. They're super comfortable and really easy to adjust—can also wear glasses under them, which is a plus. Visibility is great in both sun and overcast, and they're big enough for peripheral vision as well. Haven't had any issues with them fogging up—you can tell by the size and design that they're made to breathe well. So far, really pleased and looking forward to monitor the durability/longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these goggles in hopes of having a great pair for a ski weekend in Jackson. The product that arrived was no only the wrong size but the absolute wrong color also, ruining my hopes of using these goggles for my weekend. I’d love to have the correct goggles but I’m hesitant to return and re-order as I’m worried I’ll just get another rando pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Wessel

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these recently for a ski trip in PA, and they were great. Was hesitant to buy a pair of googles with the magnetic lenses, but these have the additional clips on the side that make it impossible for the lens to fall out. Fit was great and they were extremely comfortable. Just pay attention to the tint you order as this tint was very dark. It needs to be very sunny for this tint and I had to switch the lens out around 2 o'clock in the afternoon due to overcast skies. Otherwise these are a great ski goggles for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are a good quality pair of goggles. The lens are really easy to swap out. Adult size fit my 13yr old perfectly. He loved them and they did not fog up. The lens that came with them worked perfect for the daytime.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Shoveling goggles
customer_reviews.text: I actually live where it is pretty flat so I have not used these for skiing. However, they are excellent for shoveling in the bright sun and sledding. I can’t wear my normal sunglasses without fogging over but these work wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Schmedly

product_meta.title: Wildhorn Roca Snowboard & Ski Goggles - US Ski Team Official Supplier - Interchangeable Lens - Premium Snow Goggles
feature_bullets: CHANGE YOUR LENS IN UNDER 60 SECONDS- Designed with six rare earth N45 magnets and an integrated clip locking system the Roca ski goggles can be quickly customized in seconds for optimal performance in almost any light condition. Simply swap out for one of our seven different Aurora lens options in a wide range of colors and tints. All lens options will be made available for separate purchase.

EFFORTLESS PERFORMANCE / UNLIMITED STYLE- The Roca semi frameless snowboarding goggles were meticulously designed in Utah, home of the greatest snow on earth, to offer unparalleled performance, versatility, comfort and style for all levels.  Designed by skiers and snowboarders for skiers and snowboarders of all levels. We offer a youth size in various colors for boys and girls so they can also ride the winter slopes in style!

AURORA LENS TECHNOLOGY- Don't ruin your skiing or snowboarding trip with a sub par lens. Our WIDE VIEW panoramic spherical dual lens design with premium Anti-Fog & Anti-Scratch coating allow you to see the terrain in any light condition without distortion while also protecting your eyes from glare and harmful UV rays.

DON’T LOSE YOUR LENS- Unlike most magnetic goggles on the market, the Roca features an easy side-clip locking system designed to hold the lens in place in the event of a gnarly crash. The lens will also stay securely in place when you remove them from your face to take a break from shredding the slopes.

NEARLY INDESTRUCTIBLE YET COMFORTABLE- The Roca goggle frame is made from super durable Thermoplastic Urethane Polymer material with a premium soft touch anti slip coating. We use only the highest grade of triple layer foam for maximum comfort on your face. The lens is made from shatterproof ultra strong poly-carbonate material. These goggles can hold up under the most extreme outdoor conditions.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
